thread.title: A Luggage Executive’s Highflying Sideline
thread.title_full: A Luggage Executive’s Highflying Sideline - WSJ

author: Heidi Mitchell
title: A Luggage Executive’s Highflying Sideline
text:
Like many boys, Dieter Morszeck, chief executive of luxury-luggage company Rimowa that is known for its corrugated-aluminum hard cases, always dreamed of being a pilot.
“My first flight was with my mother on a propeller aircraft, when I was maybe 6 years old,” the 62-year-old German-native recalls. “I saw the first jet in my life, a Caravelle, in the 1960s, and was completely amazed. It became my life’s dream to be an airline... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
